txt.en: The words of Galadriel before her Mirror surface in your memory.
'A long vigil, waiting for an ally that does not come.'
'Your words must inspire, for time passes too slowly behind the walls.'
The Men of Rohan stand ready to defend the Deeping Wall, but Aragorn fears the vast extent of Saruman's forces will cause them to despair.
'They cannot stand forever, the walls, nor the Men under your command.'
'The army of Saruman numbers in the thousands.'
'The dawn seems far off, Captain; is it your fate to see it?'
'Brutal Orc and savage Dunlending tribesman unite to destroy you.'
'None can deny that we face a great enemy!'
'The time has come for victory!'
'In the hours ahead, every one of us will be tested.'
'We will stand against the Orc and we will stand against the Dunlending.'
'It may not be enough. We have little chance of victory.'
'But we will do what we can, because we must!'
'This much is certain, Men of Rohan!'
'The captain [placeholder] believes in Théoden, son of Thengel.'
'Aragorn of the Dúnedain believes in the King of the Mark.'
'On this night, the strength of Rohan will be tested.'
'Men of Rohan! The time has come to fight for your king!'
'We who stand here will determine the survival of this kingdom.'
'Do you know why this captain is here today?'
Talk to Aragorn atop the wall
'Fight for Rohan!'
'We must not fall!'
'[placeholder] is here for your king!'
'We must not be defeated!'
'We are all here for Théoden, son of Thengel!'
'We will not fail him! We will not fail your king!'
'Do you know why this captain is here today?'
'[placeholder] wishes to take care of some unfinished business.'
DNT - Blah!
'I speak of Saruman the Traitor!'
'[placeholder] will see the Wizard defeated!'
Thurketel stands atop the wall. Did Aragorn's words help him recover his hope?
Help Aragorn to bolster the spirits of the defenders on the wall
Talk to Thurketel atop the wall
Talk to Aragorn atop the wall
'Thank you for sending them to me, my friend. Now to fill them with hope and with the fire of battle!'
'This much is certain, Men of Rohan!'
'The captain [placeholder] believes in this fortress.'
'Aragorn of the Dúnedain believes the Hornburg will stand.'
'Men of Rohan! The time has come to defend these walls!'
DNT - Blah!
'Fight for Rohan!'
The men of Rohan need inspiring words if they are to stand against Saruman's forces.

'I see now the extent of Saruman's forces, and it is vast. How will the Men of Rohan keep their courage in face of such an army? I wait still for allies from afar, but none come. Where is Erkenbrand? Where are the men who fought at the Ford? We wait, but still no allies come to our aid.\n\n'You are a Captain, [placeholder], and know well how to inspire a man's heart. We need words to raise the hopes of these defenders and give them strength to fight. Gather the defenders on the wall and send them here, and we will do what we can to inspire them.'
'DNT - Blah! Regular Aragorn!'
'Thank you for sending them to me, friend Captain. Now we must fill them with hope and with the fire of battle!\n\n'What should I say to them, [placeholder]?'
'DNT - Blah! Regular Aragorn!'

'You choose your friends well, [placeholder]. This Dúnadan has me believing we might survive this night, after all!

'I am ready for Saruman's armies! Indeed, I feel like I could teach the Wizard himself a lesson with my blade, a lesson so sharp he would soon regret waging this war!

'Thank you, [placeholder]. My heart stirs for battle!'
'We have done what we can, [placeholder]. I hope it will be enough.'
'This is [placeholder], a captain from the North!'
'This kingdom is not our home-land.'
'Behold the vast armies of Saruman!'
'But today that matters not! We will fight to defend it!'
'They number in the thousands: deadly Orcs and savage Dunlending tribesmen.'
'They come to burn your land and take your lives!'

'I see now the extent of Saruman's forces, and it is vast. How will the Men of Rohan keep their courage in face of such an army?\n\n'We need words of inspiration to raise the hopes of these defenders and give them the strength to fight. Gather the defenders on the wall and send them here, and I will do what I can to inspire them.'
'This is [placeholder], a captain of great repute!'
'We have fought in many battles, and earned much honour.'
'But today that matters not! We will fight to defend this land!'
'This much is certain, Men of Rohan!'
'The captain [placeholder] believes in Rohan's strength.'
'Aragorn of the Dúnedain believes in Rohan's strength.'
'Men of Rohan! The time has come to stand and fight!'
'Fight for Rohan!'
'Do you know why this captain is here today?'
'[placeholder] is here for Rohan!'
'We are all here for Rohan! She will not fall!'
Instance: A Need for Words
'This is [placeholder], a captain of Rohan!'
Aragorn is atop the Deeping Wall, and wishes to speak with you.
'Do you know why this captain is here today? Who can say?'
'This is not my land, but both of us will fight to defend it!'
'There are so many reasons not even [placeholder] can decide!'
'On this night that is all that matters!'
'And that says much, does it not?'
Worried defenders can be found atop the wall, and Aragorn has asked you to send them to him for encouraging words.
'Now what, [placeholder]?'
Aragorn stands atop the wall, ready to speak to the worried defenders.
'I stand here with [placeholder], a mighty captain.'
'But know this, fighting men of Rohan!'
'This much is certain, Men of Rohan!'
'We will fight, and we will die if we must!'
'The captain [placeholder] believes in you.'
'But we are just like you!'
'Aragorn of the Dúnedain believes in you.'
'Men of Rohan! The time has come to fight!'
'Fight for Rohan!'
'Saruman's vast armies have come to Rohan.'
'They number in the thousands: deadly Orcs and savage Dunlending tribesmen.'
'Saruman's armies have come to Rohan.'
'We seem to face impossible odds!'
'Ferocious Orc and savage Dunlending tribesman knock upon your very doors!'
'But they are not the real foe. The real foe is much more dangerous.'
'On this night we face our own fears!'
'We cannot let them master us!'
Concerned Defender
Hopeful Defender
Confident Defender
Inspired Defender
'Men of Rohan!'
'You know [placeholder], a [placeholder] of no small skill.'
'And you know me, Aragorn of the Dúnedain.'
'But we are not the reason Saruman is going to lose this battle!'
'No, Men of Rohan!'
'On this night, Saruman's armies are going to fail because of you!'
Gather worried defenders and send them to Aragorn atop the wall ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'The time has come to fight for your land!'
'The time has come to fight for your king!'
'Men of Rohan!'
'On this night, much will be asked of each of us.'
'All of us will fight. Some of us will fall.'
'But [placeholder] knows this, and I know this:'
'On this night, the armies of Saruman will press us to our limits.'
'We can have victory! We will have victory!'
'They will attack with ferocity unmatched.'
'They will attack with a rage we have never seen.'
'But we can withstand their attacks! We can turn them back!'
